comment: Professor Cassilo was awesome! He was kind when responding to emails. He allowed us to do missing assignments for partial credit. He was happy to give feedback and was understanding about confusion. Def would take him again!

this was my second time taking COM 2135, I originally had Grindel. Cassilo is so kind and he actually does care about your writing and wants to see his students succeed. He also gave a lot of opportunities to get involved in PR or journalism related events outside of class which was very cool.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Cassilo is one of the best professors i've ever had. He gives his students all of the tools needed to succeed. He also has meetings a few times each semester with each student to go over their progress and answer any questions. Do yourself a favor and take him if you can!
Amazing professor! He knows what he is talking about and cares about his students. Very easy to talk to and contact out of class. Attending class is fun and interesting.

He truly shows that he cares about his students. If you have a chance to take him, then take him! He replies to emails quickly and gives feedback on all work. He does give a bit of assignments, but it does help you in the end. Also you do need the book for his class since he uses it for quizzes.

Professor Cassilo is one of the best professors at KSU. He really cares about his students. He listens to your concerns and takes them into consideration while grading. He responds quickly to emails and is available to answer any questions you may have. Assignments can be challenging and time consuming but really help you understand and succeed.
